tva:BasicDescription.tva:Title: Could the Pirate Party Succeed in America? - Vlogversations
tva:BasicDescription.tva:Synopsis:
The "Pirate Party" (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pirate_Party) has seen some success in European elections. Is that success something that could be replicated in the United States? A vlog conversation--"vlogversation"--between a German and a New Yorker.
More Vlogversations http://bit.ly/PgYUZA
Nico's channel http://www.youtube.com/TheDropkickSociety
If you'd like to have a Vlogversation with me, let me know! Send your pitch to danbrownuniverse@gmail.com. If you'd like to have a vlogversation with someone else on a channel other than pogobat, feel free to do that too. I consider this an open source format.
/// /// ///
twitter http://twitter.com/delicioussteak
facebook http://facebook.com/DBUniverse
tumblr http://pogobat.tumblr.com
email danbrownuniverse@gmail.com

tva:Genre.tva:Name: Humanities
tva:Genre.tva:Definition: The branches of learning regarded as having primarily a cultural character and which usually include language, literature, history, mathematics and philosophy

tva:Review.tva:FreeTextReview: I used to follow news concerning the Pirate Party but that suggestion to close the German Opera in Berlin just killed my interest for them. Because closing a huge opera with a long tradition and tons of employees to distribute the state's money to smaller art projects might sound noble but is just really fucked up. So you wanna support art and culture by eradicating a part of it? No, thanks. And I am saying that as an﻿ art student. The German opera gives me life so you better not touch it!

OMG! DOES﻿ anyone want A﻿﻿ $50﻿﻿ to $500 VISA, amazon, xbox, sephora, ebay, gap﻿﻿ and many more GIFT CARDS?﻿ i﻿ just found out abt﻿ this and it﻿ is﻿ great!!!! 1.DOWNLOAD﻿ app trailers﻿ from﻿ app store or android market﻿ (android store) from iPod﻿ iPhone﻿ iPad﻿﻿ or android 2.GO to VIDEOS﻿ and then﻿﻿ you'll see﻿ a star that says BONUS CODE....click it 3.THEN put﻿ the code: huntnow 4.THEN you'll get started with 50 !!!!! IVE EARNED $633﻿ IN THE LAST﻿ WEEK!!!!
All i want to know how to upload on﻿ PirateParty

@BoneGuyPW
ARRRGG, tis sounds like thee scurvy dogs letting ye six you﻿ olds name thee party's now.
FYI a parliamentary system does not necessarily mean that representative seats are divided proportionately! In fact many parliamentary seats are contested locally!﻿
Not to mention the Hatsune﻿ Miku one in the end
sadly, it will lose its awesome meaning after a while if it the﻿ party isn't good enough...
Aaaaaaaand that's why you﻿ REALLY have to reform your electoral system, Dan. It is holding you back.
it even has happened that the party with less votes has won because in little states you vote is wort﻿ more
Also, TYT and HowTheWorldWorks are most of the time non-biased. However, sometimes they miss facts. (Which is ALWAYS pointed out in the TYT comments,﻿ and IDK about the HTWW comments.)

but﻿ if you have 3 party's to vote for you dont have to get 50% right? cause if you get above 33,3% you can be the winner, or isn't that how it work i don't know where i live we got a parlement system, our elections are pretty soon to maybe the pirate party gets a seat, there are running
TYT is left probably 99% of the time. Where did you get﻿ the idea that they are unbiased?

I can't speak for all of Europe but what you described is really NOT how the British parliamentary system works. Our system is a local one too, infact much more so than the US one. Each seat in parliament is voted for by the voters from small a specific area of the country and that MP will then represent them in parliament. Then If one party wins a majority of the seats then it will﻿ be invited by the queen to form a government.

you misunderstand parliamentary elections, at least in the﻿ UK. We vote for local representatives rather than parties as well. The success in the UK is relative, you won't get any MPs but it just acts as a pressure group.
﻿ BECOME YOUR FUTURE!!!

I think your presumption about the parties breaking apart and losing influence is a bit idealistic. Basically all the money﻿ in politics now is coming from corporations, and they like being able to influence a large number of politicians all at once. So to that end, they'll use their resources to ensure that the major parties stick together, regardless of how dysfunctional they become.
/watch?v=MAEBgDZVLfU﻿

@isnerdy
couldn't this recklessness endanger everything both partys control of﻿ when driving at the wheel?
wat arg you talkin bout﻿ matie
I am just wondering﻿ if the pirate party has any connections to pastafarianism?
Wouldn't they just need the majority of the votes? So 33,4-50,1% of the﻿ votes?
I think it was a generalised statement, to individually draw out all the different European electoral systems would bog﻿ the video down.

They aren't "left" they﻿ are factual...
They bag on people on the right and left...

And in non-swing states, Tennessee for example. My vote doesn't matter at all.﻿ The republican will always win. You never see campaign ads here because both candidates know Romney will win it. It brings the entire campaign to just a few states
"Europe's are better"﻿ at 2:58... Yep, I saw that.
